page.title: 12Changes in Heywood.3.
page.content: These {Senior Citizens }also talked about today and how life had changed. Many thought that schools are better, though they thought that too many subjects are studied and that young people today have little respect for their elders. Views differed on whether they would like to be at school today, but none of them would like to be leaving school and looking for a job. Unemployment is a problem{ but they could not agree about the value of the {Youth Training Scheme.} They felt that {entertainment }was declining and most of them mentioned dancing and the cinema as their favourites and how these are now lacking. They felt that {Heywood}had not improved for the better and that life today is more difficult for young people. They are happy that they have lived their lives when they have.
